benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Remove tags from account

covered: Valid Deletion: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC13, TC20) validate successful deletions including single, multiple, all, very large and empty-array cases.
Input Validation: Scenarios for invalid accountId format, non-existent account, malformed tagDef, and mixed valid/invalid tagDef (TC06, TC07, TC08, TC14, TC18) cover common validation/error paths.
Headers: Required header X-Killbill-CreatedBy presence and omission are tested (TC09); optional headers X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment are tested for presence and omission (TC04, TC19).
Business Rule: The special-case rule for AUTO_PAY_OFF removal without default payment method is covered (TC10).
Error & Resilience: Service unavailability and transient network failure are addressed (TC12, TC16), producing 5xx and retry behavior respectively.
Authorization: Unauthorized access is considered (TC15) with expected 401/403 handling.
Concurrency & Performance: Concurrent request handling and acceptable response time are explicitly tested (TC17).
Empty State: Removing from an account with no tags is handled (TC05) and confirms idempotent behavior.
gaps: Pagination: No tests address pagination or chunked behavior when querying/processing very large tag lists (relevant to GET-style behaviours and large result sets).
Caching Behavior: No scenarios verify caching-related headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or cache invalidation after tag changes.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests exercise rate limits, burst traffic limits, or client throttling behavior.
Soft Delete / Persistence Semantics: No explicit checks for soft-delete semantics (e.g., tombstone vs physical delete) or audit/history verification after deletion.
Response Content & Headers: Tests do not validate response headers (Content-Type, Content-Length) or that error response bodies follow API error schema/structure beyond containing a message.

Edge-case transactional consistency: While concurrency is tested for throughput, there are no tests for race conditions around simultaneous remove/add of the same tag (conflicting operations) and eventual consistency windows.
recommendations: Add pagination tests (even if endpoint is DELETE, include tests for backend behavior when the system must process large tag sets) or explicit acceptance that pagination is N/A for this endpoint.
Introduce caching tests to assert Cache-Control/ETag behavior and ensure cache invalidation occurs after tag removals.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to confirm proper 429 handling under heavy/burst traffic.
Add tests to assert persistence semantics: verify whether deletions are soft (record kept for auditing) or hard (physically removed), and test audit/log entries if required.
Validate response headers and error payload schema for both success and error cases to ensure consistent API contract.
Add conflict/race-condition tests that perform concurrent add/remove operations on the same tag for the same account to confirm deterministic behavior and correctness.
